reviewText:
Wobbly Jungle - Review
Gameplay:
When I first looked at this game I didn't expect much from it. Looked like a very basic, simple platformer. And whilst it isn't revolutionizing the genre, it certainly did a very good job at offering challenging, long lasting and varying gameplay.
The controls are very basic - move and jump - with the addition of double jumps and wall jumps.
Whilst the game seemed to be quite simple at the first few levels, I soon was faced with a repertory of crazy and challenging
twists - forcing me to act both fast, and cleverly.
The game offers 60 levels, which come with lots of hours of diverse adventure.
The only real problem I encountered whilst ingame, was the camera management - often you don't see where you need to jump and you're just forced to leap and hope for the best.
Thus, the gameplay overall is solid, what is missing are some other things:
The menus are very confusing and lack some features (for instance the ability to manage the volume!), and the game comes
with only one track, which repeats every 3 minutes.
Furthermore, great potential was given up, by leaving out the ability to create own levels and share those.

Pros:
+High variety in gameplay
+A lot of content
+Challenging
+Simple controls

Cons:
-Poor menu management
-Soundtrack consists of one track

Conclusion:
Alltogether I can praise this game for both its length and challenge and can only recommend it.
8.5/10


If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: Follow Original Curator Group

reviewText:
When I first looked at this side-scrolling platformer, I've known at once it will be like Mario (Mario with edited levels, to be precise). And I doubted I'll manage to make a quick run with it.
Boy, I was right. The game is quite challenging just from the start, and I really don't know how many hours of pain and rage-quitting it will bring to people, but I'm sure there will be plenty.

I'm still not that deep into to name Wobbly Jungle a rival for the Super Meat Boy... But surely, it is much, so much more killing than any of the Dark Souls, self-proclaimed hard games".

So. The game is tough and challenging

reviewText:
Forget the cute graphics and presentation. Sourena Game Studio’s second game on Steam, Wobbly Jungle, is one of the most difficult precision platformers that I have ever played. And that’s a wonderful thing. The studio based in Iran previously developed Legends of Persia (not to be mistaken with Ubisoft’s Prince of Persia franchise). I have to admit that I was almost going to quit the game without having completed the second level as it wasn’t immediately clear where I had to go after reaching a certain point in the level. Thankfully the skill that was being taught in that level, the double jump, held the answer to my prayer and I was able to continue on and complete the level.

I unfortunately do not have very much to write about the game because of just how difficult the game is. This is a game that I want to dedicate some time to so that I can write a better review. I find the graphical presentation to be more than suitable except when you’re left guessing at what is off screen which resulted in most of my deaths. I would argue that this is unfair but that’s my personal opinion. The music sounds good but unfortunately becomes quite repetitive. This is a little bit of a disappointment because had the soundtrack been more varied it would have been a very good soundtrack. The controls are a little on the floaty side but not to the point where it is a detriment to the game. If you spend enough time with the game they will become comfortable.

Although I haven’t gotten very far into the game as of yet I am definitely leaning on the positive side. There’s just the right amount of charm to keep you engaged with the game thanks to good, not great, production values and factoring the sub-$5 price tag.

reviewText:
Wobbly Jungle is a new one platformer game with cute design and good music.

In this game you will find only one single player mode. In this game you have same goal like in other same games, just pass you current level. Here you will find a lot of different levels and at all level different enemies. Sometimes you can kill enemies, but better always avoid them. This game is very challenging and require you best skills to pass it.Also you will find here a very cute and nice world. The game controls are enough good with gamepad, but with keyboard i think even better to not start this game, because its bring for you only frustration. The music also good, especially if you like a electronic style music.

So my verdict

+ cute world
+ nice electronic music
+ steam achievements
+ challenging
+ a lot of various levels

- no steam cards
- hard control with keyboard

This game is enough good, have nice cute world, a lot of various levels and nice music. If you like platformers games and your are looking for a challenging gameplay this game for you.

reviewText:
A Platformerhttps://youtu.be/zOOfm7yp5Ac
+ For a platformer this game has very fine tuned controls, very precise and fluid movements similar to Super Meat Boy
+ Very cute and colorful levels and creatures
+ Upbeat background music (in combination with the level design it made me smile)
+ Slowly introduces new mechanics and challenging enemies

- I would have liked to have seen more variety in the environments, music, and more story elements
- Since you can't zoom out, there are a LOT of jumps that are leaps of faiths" or in other words you can't see where you are jumping or falling to and this can sometimes lead to deaths / starting the level over if you fall or miss a platform.
"

reviewText: If you ever feel TOO happy, play some Wobbly Jungle and that happiness will vanish in the blink of an eye. At times you may feel like a champion throughout some of the levels, thinking to yourself ``Hmm, this is actually fun and easy´´ but that wont last long... A sudden heatwave surrounds your body, only to make you sweat and rage whenever that little pink creature (trying to save his girlfriend, that you most likely wont see happening unless you beat this ♥️♥️♥️♥️ing game...) gets caught in a wave of needles time after time after time. There you go, still feeling too happy?\n\n10/10 would rage again

reviewText:
Super hard side-scroller with cute graphics!
You are cute little character that tries to survive in this cute but evil world full of different kind of enemies and obstacles!

I think this game is best played with friend. Try to be first one to beat whole level!

Pros
Super hard!
You bounce off if you get damage
Hard controller controls (You press accidentally slightly down and you won't jump so much)
Cons
One song that plays over and over in level will stuck to your brain forever
Can't see how many stars you have in levels
Conclusion: Super hard platformer with floaty controls. Best played in 20min gaming session!

Tested on:

Hardware        Type                Motherboard        ASUSTeK P8H67              GPU        Nvidia GTX 560                OS        Windows 10 pro 64bit            CPU        Intel i5 2500K            RAM        8GB DDR3             HDD        500gb HDD                Controller        Xbox One lunar white

reviewText:
Woobly Jungle is maybe the cutest platformer game I ever played. Seems simple but it is not! I really like platform games and levels are very complicated. The enemies are also cute, I always expect bad guys, zombies, etc but not there are many cute things in this game.

I played with the keyboard but I think this is a game for a joystick, due the quantity of jumpings needed to complete each level. Also, sometimes you cannot see anything but the little islands in the sky be afraid of kill tour character and restart level. Is not easy, I promise.

There are good things ahead, try to complete the levels and you'll see new tasks and difficulties.

Art concept is cute and the music very nice, so I really enjoy playing this game.

Thanks, devs!
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Tight controls and brutal difficulty, that\'s Wobbly Jungle for ya. It\'s rare when a game is this difficult and yet doesn\'t pull any truly dirty tricks. Every death feels like it\'s your own fault and not the game being cheap. I can recommend this game for anyone who likes platformers.
